_meta.description: Prompts for LLM to generate auth-related copy. These describe WHAT each text should accomplish, not the final text itself.

common.email: Email input label. Keep it simple and clear.
common.password: Password input label. Standard form label.
common.confirmPassword: Password confirmation input label. Make it clear it should match the first password.
common.rememberMe: Checkbox label to stay logged in. Optional convenience feature.
common.orContinueWith: Divider text before OAuth buttons. Keep it short.
common.and: Conjunction for legal links. Ex: 'Terms of Service and Privacy Policy'
common.backToHome: Link to return to homepage. Ex: 'Back to Home', 'Go home'
common.backToLogin: Link to return to login page from other auth pages.

login.login: Primary heading for login page or button text. Ex: 'Log In', 'Sign In', 'Welcome Back'
login.welcomeBack: Welcoming heading for login page. Make it friendly and personal.
login.forgotPassword: Link text for password reset flow. Make it obvious and helpful.
login.dontHaveAccount: Prompt to register. Include context. Ex: 'Don't have an account?'
login.loggingIn: Button text while login is processing. Ex: 'Signing in...', 'Logging in...'
login.magicLink: Button text to request magic link (passwordless). Ex: 'Send magic link', 'Email me a login link'
login.loginWithMagicLink: Alternative login option heading. Ex: 'Sign in with magic link'
login.sendingMagicLink: Status text while sending magic link. Ex: 'Sending link...', 'Sending...'
login.lastUsed: Label showing when auth method was last used. Ex: 'Last used', 'Used recently'
login.tryResetPassword: Helpful prompt when password fails. Ex: 'Wrong password?', 'Forgot it?'
login.autoMagicLinkSent: Info message when auto-sending magic link as fallback. Include {email} placeholder. Ex: 'We couldn't verify your password. We've sent a login link to {email}'

register.register: Primary heading for registration page or button text. Ex: 'Sign Up', 'Create Account', 'Get Started'
register.createAccount: Button text to submit registration. Action-oriented. Ex: 'Create Account', 'Join Now', 'Sign Up'
register.creatingAccount: Button text while registration is processing. Ex: 'Creating account...', 'Setting up...'
register.alreadyHaveAccount: Prompt to login instead of register. Include context.
register.agreeToTerms: Checkbox label for legal agreement. Be clear but concise. Ex: 'I agree to the'
register.termsOfService: Link text for terms document. Ex: 'Terms of Service', 'Terms & Conditions'
register.privacyPolicy: Link text for privacy document. Standard legal term.

magicLink.checkEmail: Success message after sending magic link. Tell user what to do next. Ex: 'Check your email for a magic link'
magicLink.sendingResetLink: Status text while sending. Ex: 'Sending...', 'Sending link...'

resetPassword.resetPassword: Heading for password reset page. Ex: 'Reset Password', 'Forgot Password?'
resetPassword.sendResetLink: Button text to request reset link. Ex: 'Send Reset Link', 'Email me a reset link'
resetPassword.resetPasswordSuccess: Success message after sending reset email. Tell user what to do next.
resetPassword.newPassword: Label for new password input. Ex: 'New Password', 'Choose a new password'
resetPassword.updatePassword: Button to submit new password. Ex: 'Update Password', 'Save New Password'
resetPassword.passwordUpdated: Success message after password change. Reassure user and suggest next step.

passwordRequirements._note: Requirements list shown to help user create valid password
passwordRequirements.minLength: Minimum character requirement. Ex: 'At least 6 characters', '8+ characters'
passwordRequirements.hasNumber: Must include number requirement. Ex: 'Contains a number'
passwordRequirements.hasLetter: Must include letter requirement. Ex: 'Contains a letter'
passwordRequirements.hasSpecial: Must include special char requirement. Ex: 'Contains a special character (!@#$...)'

verifyEmail.verifyEmail: Heading for email verification page. Ex: 'Verify Your Email', 'Check Your Inbox'
verifyEmail.verifyEmailDescription: Explanation of what happened and what user should do. Be clear and helpful. Mention checking inbox and clicking link.
verifyEmail.checkEmailVerification: Alternative short message. Ex: 'Check your email to verify your account'
verifyEmail.resendEmail: Button to resend verification email. Ex: 'Resend email', 'Send again'
verifyEmail.emailResent: Success message after resending. Ex: 'Verification email resent', 'Email sent!'

oauth.oauthSignIn: Button text for OAuth login. Include {provider} placeholder. Ex: 'Sign in with {provider}', 'Continue with {provider}'
oauth.oauthSignUp: Button text for OAuth registration. Include {provider} placeholder. Ex: 'Sign up with {provider}'
oauth.googleOneTapError: Error message when Google One Tap fails. Be helpful. Ex: 'Could not sign in with Google. Please try again.'

errors.authError: Generic error heading. Ex: 'Authentication Error', 'Something went wrong'
errors.authErrorDescription: Generic error explanation. Be reassuring and suggest action. Ex: 'Something went wrong during authentication. Please try again.'
errors.tryAgain: Button to retry after error. Ex: 'Try Again', 'Retry'

states.loggedOut: Success message after logout. Ex: 'You have been logged out successfully', 'See you soon!'
